availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Abram G. Wileman (Pendleton County, Kentucky doctor and major 18th Ky Inf)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, physician and soldier. Ohio native. Married to Parthena Rice Wileman. Father of Dalton Wileman. Physician in Pendleton County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the Police Guard Kentucky Central Railroad as captain from November 5, 1861, to November 17, 1861. Served in the 18th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as captain and major from February 8, 1862, to Feruary 8, 1863. Killed by James Keller in Pendleton County on October 5, 1863.

ab.bibl:
